title: LemonNation introduces support Nautilus to the NA LCS

replies.body: Ive Mained Nautilus support for two seasons now. They laughed and pointed fingers. Now everybody sees how useful an undying CC Behemoth is thanks to Lemonation. Now he'll probably be getting nerfed a bit too ;-;
i always main {{champion:111}}  support  from when he came out
it is so good... you never have to back and you never die

It's always how it's been.
Low elos call you a troll because you didn't pick a FOTM champion.  Then suddenly when a LCS player picks that champ and snowballs, suddenly everyone stops saying anything.  Meanwhile, the toxic people who reported you for 'trolling' with a trollpick?  Probably still gold or silver while you got punished....

This is why you MUTE everyone at ANY sign of flaming and then report them after the game without retaliating.  They'll be banned and you'll still get to rock with that nautilus/lissandra/karthus/wukong support.

P.S. ANYONE can be used mid lane but melee champions are worst at mid because the lane is so short, that ranged champions can harass you and farm safely under their tower.

ANYONE can go top lane, but counters are harder to deal with at top than at mid because the lane is too long, so freezes and starving are too hard to deal with if you can't trade hits or wave clear.

ANYONE can support.

ANYONE can jungle as long as they have wave clear or sustain.

You can win even without an ADC as long as the person substituting for the marksman has high damage scaling and wave clear, enough DPS to melt tanks and is not shut down (Karthus anyone?)

Karthus and Cassiopia are getting played to death again because people realized they are VERY good at melting tanks.

ive seen talon adc by accedent and he got so fed bot lane xD
ps i do karthus jg just casue the ulti is like OP
tell that to bjerg and zed
why is this news? so many people have done this that it is kinda old now......

Why is this news? The post **isn't about Nautilus support. It's about the LCS.** "Once again, Daerek "LemonNation" Hart has brought something new to the bottom lane of the North American LCS. Last time, it was support Veigar, but as of Week 8 of the NA LCS, he's been the first NA player to bring out Nautilus support."** It says he is the first to bring Nautilus to the NA LCS. **
That's how it is... Meta Zombies have no brains and can only do something once the pros do it I also used to support Naut .. hell when he first came out i used to top him instead of jungle

id hate to see a naut nerf seeing how he suffered in the jg. i usto main naut jg and seeing this happen is saddening. i have nothing against him being a support but the buffs were not in the right places. insted of pushing him back into the jg like they wanted they shoved him into support where the e buff is amazing and you didnt care about the w damage. the cinderhulk did almost nothing for him sadly because by the time he gets it he already hit his power spike and has his own clear speed incredible fast. i feel sad that now he will be pushed further down because of this. ;( may naut return to being viable again. {{champion:111}} {{item:3070}}

ARE YOU CRAZY?? Naut jg is SOOoooo strong right now. I've frequently played him jg for the last two seasons and i must say, this was needed. with the new jungle being stong he didnt have that survivability to get a good gank, or sustain. Now with his boosted W to add some tank and cinderhulkto increase clears is awesome! I <3 current naut.
Well keep something in mind, the reason Lemon picked up Nautilus support is because he got buffed in the first place.  If he gets nerfed again, he'll just be in the same spot.

if you "mained him" two seasons now...that's not something to brag about. For the last two years straight they have had to buff naut because he sucked and was overly weak. So, you're bragging about playing someone that RIOT themselves proved to not be a good choice...i.e them having to buff him slightly like 10 times over two years.
That said, naut was used more as a support than jungler and top, so,,,"you" didn't main him as much as the majority of players who played naut did as well..

#logic

Just because Riot says they need to strengthen a champion doesn't mean they sucked in the first place. It means the rest of the champions, or the items, or, as in more recent scenarios, the jungle camps have gotten stronger than the champion Riot ends up buffing. Nearly every champion has had a buff or two and a nerf or two in the last two years. 

The fact the they have had to "buff him slightly like 10 times over two years" is actually a testament to the inherit strength in kit. Some champions, like Sion for instance, were so far behind and their kits were so underwhelming, that Riot remade the entire champion. Riot prides themselves on their balance levers, which is their ability to make small adjustments to champions when they start to get too weak or too strong. These levers are pulled when the rest of the game changes, not because a champion was built to be crappy.

nothing you said is right lol
Also, if you played a champion two years ago, that's nothing the same to playing him today. The game itself has changed, items and champs. 
It's stupid to think it's equatable
They laughed because naut was le garbo. He got buffed. Now hes not. End of story. I woulda laughed at you too

Exactly, i started maining nautilius support last season, i did great. My friends laughed and said it would never work. LOOK AT ME NOW. Does this make me a hipster? Let it be known, nautilius will destrioy his lane and 1v1 their ADC WITH PRIDE!!!!!!!

P.S.
{{champion:113}} Support anyone? just grab some AP runes and max out that Q. You will bassicly destroy their health and your adc can just "pop" them right off the face of the rift.

I used {{champion:111}} for supporting quite often in Seasons 3 - 4 actually. He is seriously a monster down there. A lot of AD players frowned on it because he is obviously not your typical legend of choice for support. But.... I still love him =) IN fact,  I think I'm going to play support Naut at bot lane tonight. Whoop. =)

Does this mean people will stop raging at me when I pick Naut support?

Oh right they'll still tower dive as an adc and blame me, nm.  Community OP  :P

If I had dollar for every pick that entitled ragers have completely gone apeshit over that ended up showing up in the LCS and becoming an accepted norm...

As someone who mains support this honestly irritates me, now i feel like i cant play Naut support anymore as well as Lee Sin (Works amazingly well) because everyone is going to think I'm on the bandwagon.This community is toxic towards new ideas but if a pro does it then everyone thinks its fine.
Who cares what anyone else thinks? Just play who you want to. :-)

I've been playing naut support since season 4, and everyone would make fun of me for it... something about too low of a movement speed?  Either way, maybe i won't be harassed in champ select anymore.  Thanks Lemon!

love the Article , but introducing support Naut? really Riot? Naut and shen for then win. I love Nautilus , been one of my best and favorites since his patch . Bottom lane me with anyone and you too can experience the PURE POWER of NAUTILUS . so i guess Thank you Lemon for showing /Repn Naut. happy hunting summoners

Just for clarification {{champion:111}} has been played bot by myself and my little brother since his release.  Why is he just now getting shown bot lane!  He's great support especially matched up with a Sivir, Jinx, Lucian, or Varus.  Way to finally make it bot lane in the LCS Naut I've been pulling for you forever and it's good to see you finally spark up in the pros bot lane comp!

Because, everyone feels if it isn't played in competitive the champ isn't worth it. No one can think for themselves and decide if a champ is worth playing or not. You should see my champ pool, it's one of the least "Viable" set of champs lol.
Am I the only one that has been doing this since beginning of season 4? Ban blitz and leona, then lock Nautilus gg

I love all the "I used to use this blah blah blah..." comments, when the damned champ in question only became viable in a given role extremely recently. 

Essentially, what you're saying is, "I was too stubborn to drop the champ when it sucked, but now you all shall bow to my ability to play bad things until they become viable!"

Kudos to you, brave summoner, for ignoring logic until coincidence proves you right.

Yes some champions are stronger then other champs, but that doesn't mean that a champion is weak or bad. Some champs fit in one comp or another, you'll be surprised. Open up, the meta doesn't mean play xyz champs because their the best, it means champs xyz are really good. All champions when played correctly can be good, think of the meta as a suggestion, not a guideline.
*cough* {{champion:6}} *cough*

You haven't seen support Urgot yet, but trust me.

You will.

Ive done it, and my adc and I won around 5 games in a row with it. That is most likely due to the fact that I can harass. I didnt do any "supporting" as supportgot, but instead zoned them out with spike damage from targeted acid hunter. The ult was not very strong for support even though it may seem to be, mainly due to its long cooldown. Long story short, Urgot support can do enough damage to stop the enemies from doing much, but he is not a very good support.

To be totally honest, I was surprised at how LemonNation played Nautilus for most of both games. He spent a lot of time wandering around behind his carries, that's part of why they lost the second game, he was wandering behind Corki (partially Corki's fault) the team. Corki got hooked and blown up stranding Naut. This led to him dying as well.

Even in the laning phase he basically never roamed even though the Naut pick power is potentially really high. And, even though he stayed in lane, he didn't really go for any 'Thresh-esque' plays for the vast majority of the time (even the casters were talking up the 'kill-lane' potential).

Honestly, it felt like he was, for the most part, playing Nautilus like he would play Annie, and, honestly, at that point I feel like Annie would have just been better as he wasn't fully capitalizing on Naut's kit.

All that being said, I like Lemon's play overall, and he is obviously more skilled than me, but in LCS or out I haven't been a big fan of his Naut play. Still, credit to him for doing what I considered impossible this split and pulling Naut out of the depths. {{champion:111}}

Pretty frustrating to be sure. If you are going to tell people Naut support really is as viable as he is then don't play him like a second jungler.

Oh well, it'll separate the true Naut supports from the copy cats when the copy cats can't figure out why their roaming Naut sucks/falls behind on exp/never has enough gold

MAAAAAAANNN...........Ive been playing Nautilus support since last season!!!
Edit: And every game I went up against a Thresh support in ranked, I won us the lane, no matter how many times he hooked my adc.
Thresh gets eaten alive by support Naut. It really is pretty funny how frustrated Thresh's get when they experience laning against a Nautilus for the first time.

Patch 5.6
We noticed Nautilus can be played as a support, so we are making his ult a non champion targeting skillshot with reduced damage and now slows instead of knocking up!
We also decided to change his E and make the animation slower by 50%
We feel that this would make the champion more FUN.
When I first got Naut, all I ever heard was that he was a support. I'd never seen or heard of him jungle. Then when I did find, he became my favorite jungler.
Nautilus with that helmet....(heart melts~~~~ {{champion:111}}

Ditttooo. I started playing Naut support when i bought him because I mained support at the time and always take champs there as a comfort choice when i want to first learn them.

Another really great support? Kennen. I can play kennen any lane, any role, any day. I prefer jungle, but in order for that to work well you need a team who can hold their own until 6.

Just goes to show. There is no meta.
Sooo.. I'm from NA and I've done this for the past two or three seasons. Where is my post calling me the first? Pretty insulting to read this saying he's the first when it was already a thing.
So many champs hated on in lane that i play suddenly become amazing as soon as an LCS player tries it. will {{champion:79}}  jungle also be commonly played now, too?
New support? BULLSHIT! I did this back in season 3.
Now that  support {{champion:111}} is known by the lcs how much longer till someone tries top lane with him in it.
They probably won't. Top lane Naut is a pretty shaky position to start with, and these recent patches really make it unviable.

that is actually a fun role for {{champion:111}}  because of the trades with his e. you just gotta play smart same with any champ or role. though a wrong/missed q and you are left out to dry like a Naut out of water

Yeah I main support, and I tried Naut before he was played by Lemon. He's a good support. Period. Even before he got buffed, he was good. Just not my style, so all you Naut supports, go smash dat bot lane! {{champion:111}}

I have been using Nautilus support since Season 3 he is my main support in season 4 ranked. You guys are just finding out about it now? Ketch up{{item:3174}} C9. But seriously the best player you could possible play anywhere is obviously the one and only. Urgod Mid{{champion:6}} {{item:1056}}
Naut has always been a good choice for support. He has a kockup, stun, grab, and slow...

You sitting on me? one of my fave supports along with the {{champion:98}} taunt machine. is making it into the LCS. i feel like a trend setter right now however wrong that feeling may be.LOL nothing like a good anchor to pull that one sheep out of a retreating herd.
LOL i played a ranked game againt Riot Robotayco, and he was support naut, destroyed us
